Key Match Events: India made a challenging 176 for seven
South Africa moved within sniffing distance when the Bumrah-Hardik-Arshdeep trio delivered the knockout punch
Post-Match Reflections: There was an undeniable sense of relief as well, as India finally managed to cross the final hurdle after two heartbreaking falls in just the last year
Virat Kohli looked up the sky with hands aloft
Rohit Sharma was mobbed by his teammates, and the support staff ran onto the ground with the National flag
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game seemed to slip away when South Africa got ahead in the chase
A 72-run fourth-wicket partnership was exactly what India needed to stay afloat
Others: Axar Patel and Kohli calmed nerves with sensible batting
Axar knew his role well, having performed this task against Pakistan earlier in the tournament
Axar, however, stopped in his track for a moment. Wicketkeeper Quinton de Kock took full advantage, throwing down the stumps at the bowler’s end to catch Axar short
Kohli’s desire to make it count was evident when he did not acknowledge cheers for his fifty
